perturbation.original_text: Subject to the restrictions set forth in Section 5.1 of this Agreement and Section 2.3 of the Warrant, in the event any member of the Farids Group proposes to Transfer (other than a Permitted Transfer) a Threshold Block, in a transaction or series of related transactions, of Shares in a 144 Sale, the Farids Group shall furnish to the Company a written notice of such proposed Transfer (a "ROFO Sale Notice") at least 48 hours prior to the opening of trading on the Nasdaq Global Market (or such other primary stock exchange upon which the Common Stock is listed) on the business day that the Farids Group proposes to begin to effect such 144 Sale.
perturbation.changed_text: Subject to the restrictions set forth in Section 5.1 of this Agreement and Section 2.3 of the Warrant, in the event any member of the Farids Group proposes to Transfer (other than a Permitted Transfer) a Threshold Block, in a transaction or series of related transactions, of Shares in a 144 Sale, the Farids Group shall furnish to the Company a written notice of such proposed Transfer (a "ROFO Sale Notice") at least 12 hours prior to the opening of trading on the Nasdaq Global Market (or such other primary stock exchange upon which the Common Stock is listed) on the business day that the Farids Group proposes to begin to effect such 144 Sale.
perturbation.explanation: The modification reduces the notice period for a proposed transfer of shares from 48 hours to 12 hours. This creates a contradiction because, depending on the state, providing only 12 hours' notice might violate securities regulations requiring reasonable notice for significant transactions to protect shareholders and ensure market transparency. The change fails to meet standard notification periods and increases the risk of insufficient disclosure.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State and Federal Securities Laws (e.g., Securities Act of 1933, Exchange Act of 1934) often require reasonable notice for material transactions.

perturbation.original_text: (c) If the Company wishes to purchase (and/or cause a designee to purchase) all or a portion of the ROFO Shares at the ROFO Sale Price, the Company shall deliver a notice (a "ROFO Purchase Notice") to the Farids Group no later 8:00 a.m. New York time on the business day that the Farids Group proposes to effect such 144 Sale specifying the number of ROFO Shares it wishes to purchase (and/or cause a designee to purchase) from the Farids Group. The closing of the purchase of such ROFO Shares by the Company and/or any such designee shall take place no later than five (5) business days after delivery of the ROFO Purchase Notice, with payment for such ROFO Shares being made concurrently with such purchase to the Farids Group's account designated in the ROFO Sale Notice. If the Company does not timely deliver a ROFO Purchase Notice it shall be deemed to have waived all of its rights with respect to the offer contained in the ROFO Sale Notice.
perturbation.changed_text: (c) If the Company wishes to purchase (and/or cause a designee to purchase) all or a portion of the ROFO Shares at the ROFO Sale Price, the Company shall deliver a notice (a "ROFO Purchase Notice") to the Farids Group no later 11:59 p.m. New York time 3 days after the business day that the Farids Group proposes to effect such 144 Sale specifying the number of ROFO Shares it wishes to purchase (and/or cause a designee to purchase) from the Farids Group. The closing of the purchase of such ROFO Shares by the Company and/or any such designee shall take place no later than ten (10) business days after delivery of the ROFO Purchase Notice, with payment for such ROFO Shares being made concurrently with such purchase to the Farids Group's account designated in the ROFO Sale Notice. If the Company does not timely deliver a ROFO Purchase Notice it shall be deemed to have waived all of its rights with respect to the offer contained in the ROFO Sale Notice.
perturbation.explanation: The change alters the timeline for delivering a 'ROFO Purchase Notice' and closing the purchase of shares. By extending the period to 3 days and also 10 business days after the notice, it conflicts with standard market practices requiring prompt action on such offers, also delaying the closing by extending the period, which could be considered unreasonable and thus unenforceable. Such delays can violate requirements for timely transactions under securities laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State and Federal Securities Laws (e.g., Securities Act of 1933, Exchange Act of 1934) principles of good faith and fair dealing in contract law.

perturbation.original_text: (a) Subject to the restrictions set forth in Section 5.1 of this Agreement and Section 2.3 of the Warrant, in the event any member of the Farids Group proposes to Transfer (other than a Permitted Transfer) (i) a Threshold Block, in a transaction or series of related transactions, that, to the Farids Group's knowledge (after due inquiry in connection with a private, non-open market transaction) is to a Person whom the Company reasonably determines is a direct or indirect material competitor of the Company or any Affiliate of such Person or (ii) a Significant Block, in a transaction or series of related transactions, that, to the Farids Group's knowledge (after due inquiry in connection with a private, non-open market transaction) is to a Person whom the Company reasonably determines is a direct or indirect material competitor of the Company or any Affiliate of such Person (in each case, regardless of whether such Transfer will constitute a 144 Sale), the Farids Group shall furnish to the Company a written notice of such proposed Transfer (a "ROFR Sale Notice") at least (5) business days prior to the business day that the Farids Group proposes to effect such Transfer.
perturbation.changed_text: (a) Subject to the restrictions set forth in Section 5.1 of this Agreement and Section 2.3 of the Warrant, in the event any member of the Farids Group proposes to Transfer (other than a Permitted Transfer) (i) a Threshold Block, in a transaction or series of related transactions, that, to the Farids Group's knowledge (after due inquiry in connection with a private, non-open market transaction) is to a Person whom the Company reasonably determines is a direct or indirect material competitor of the Company or any Affiliate of such Person or (ii) a Significant Block, in a transaction or series of related transactions, that, to the Farids Group's knowledge (after due inquiry in connection with a private, non-open market transaction) is to a Person whom the Company reasonably determines is a direct or indirect material competitor of the Company or any Affiliate of such Person (in each case, regardless of whether such Transfer will constitute a 144 Sale), the Farids Group shall furnish to the Company a written notice of such proposed Transfer (a "ROFR Sale Notice") at least one (1) business day prior to the business day that the Farids Group proposes to effect such Transfer.
perturbation.explanation: The change reduces the notice period for a proposed transfer of shares to a competitor from 5 business days to 1 business day. This could be seen as too short a time frame, failing to allow the company adequate opportunity to assess the implications of the transfer, seek legal counsel, and potentially exercise its rights. Some jurisdictions mandate longer notification periods for transactions involving competitors under antitrust laws to allow for regulatory review.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Antitrust Laws (e.g., Hart-Scott-Rodino Act) and principles of good faith and fair dealing in contract law.
